content:
• Tuesday, November 28, 2017
  • GBTC

    Bitcoin blasts through $10K

    • Bitcoin was flirting with the $10K level all day, and finally pushed through about 30 minutes ago. The current price is $10,069.
    • "This is a bubble and there is a lot of froth," said hedge funder Mike Novogratz at a well-attended cryptocurrency conference this afternoon. "This is going to be the biggest bubble of our lifetimes." Novogratz made some headlines a few weeks back when he called for Bitcoin to hit $10K by year-end. This week he suggested $40K by the close of 2018.
    • Meanwhile, longtime value investor Murray Stahl has made a fortune for his fund with a $7M Bitcoin purchase two years ago. He says Bitcoin's worth could be equal to the value of all the globe's fiat currencies. Doing some quick work, Barron's figures that at about $361K per coin.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 PM | 136 Comments
  • INFO

    IHS Markit prices upsized $500M debt offering

    • IHS Markit (NASDAQ:INFO) has priced a debt offering it's upsized to $500M.
    • The company will offer that amount in senior notes due 2026, bearing annual interest of 4%.
    • Net proceeds will repay outstanding amounts under its revolving credit facility.
    • The offering's expected to close Dec. 1.
    • Shares gained 1.7% during market hours today.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 PM
  • DLPH

    Delphi heads to MidCap index; Contango out of SmallCap 600, shares -4.3%

    • Auto parks maker Delphi Technologies (NYSE:DLPH) will see its same-named spin-off land in the S&P MidCap 400 after it separates from its parent, which will rename itself Aptiv.
    • Aptiv itself (the former Delphi) will remain in the S&P 500 after the transaction.
    • Making room for DLPH in the MidCap 400 is Frontier Communications (NYSE:FTR), no longer representative of the mid-cap space, S&P says. It will move to the SmallCap 600.
    • And clearing out of the SmallCap 600 to make room for Frontier is Contango Oil & Gas (NYSEMKT:MCF), at the bottom with a market cap now below $100M. Contango is 4.3% lower in postmarket trading after the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM | 8 Comments
  • WAIR

    Wesco Aircraft -17% after guiding 2018 towards low end of expectations

    • Wesco Aircraft (NYSE:WAIR) -16.9% after-hours as it reports FQ4 earnings and revenue that both miss expectations amid a loss of $38.3M vs. a profit in the year ago quarter.
    • WAIR says FQ4 sales under long-term contracts were higher in the quarter but overall revenues fell primarily due to a decline in ad-hoc sales volumes and provisions for customer claims.
    • WAIR is targeting a low single-digit percentage increase Y/Y in net sales for FY 2018 vs. +4% consensus, primarily based on the ramp up of new business and growth in ad-hoc sales, and targets a low double-digit percentage increase in adjusted EBITDA primarily based on higher sales and gross margin and stable SG&A as a percent of sales.
    • The company forecasts a better H2 than H1, and thus expects to exit the year at an adjusted EBITDA margin run-rate of more than 10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • ATO

    Atmos Energy to launch $400M offering

    • Atmos Energy (NYSE:ATO) -2.7% after-hours as it commences a public offering of $400M in common shares.
    • ATO says it plans to use the proceeds to repay short-term debt, fund capital spending primarily to enhance the safety and reliability of its system, and for general corporate purposes.
    • The company expects the offering will cover its anticipated equity capital raising needs for FY 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: NUAN +5.2%. XNET +4.9%. CYTK +4.8%. INSY +2.6%. MRVL +2.5%.
    • Losers: WAIR -18.1%. GSUM -13.5%. ADSK -11.6%. TDOC -7.1%. USAK -5.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • SHLX

    Shell Midstream Partners to buy additional assets from Shell

    • Shell Midstream Partners (NYSE:SHLX) +1.8% after-hours as it agrees to acquire from Royal Dutch Shell interests in five products terminals, two Gulf of Mexico corridor pipelines and two strategic onshore pipelines for $825M.
    • The assets include a 100% interest in Triton West LLC, which owns the Anacortes, Colex, Des Plaines, Portland and Seattle products terminals backed by take-or-pay contracts with wholly owned subsidiaries of Shell.
    • Also included are a 22.9% interest in Mars Oil Pipeline; a 22% interest in Odyssey Pipeline - both of which serve the Gulf of Mexico - a 10% interest in Explorer Pipeline, owner of a 1,830-mile products pipeline extending from Gulf Coast refineries to the upper midwest; and a 41.48% interest in LOCAP LLC, which owns a 55-mile common carrier crude pipeline from the LOOP Clovelly Salt Dome facility to the St. James, La., trading hub.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • TDOC

    Teladoc readies stock offering; shares down 1% after hours

    • Teladoc (NYSE:TDOC) initiates a public offering of 4.08M shares of common stock, including 830K shares by existing stockholders. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 612K shares.
    • The company will use its net proceeds to repay borrowings under its senior secured term loan facility, for working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage drops 3% despite Q3, guidance beats

    • Pure Storage (NYSE:PSTG) shares are down 3.8% aftermarket despite Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Q4 guidance has revenue from $327M to $335M (consensus: $330.68M) and FY18 guidance puts revenue from $1.012B to $1.02B (consensus: $1.01B).
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 66.4%; operating margin, -0.7%; customer additions, +300; operating expenses, $223.6M; cash and equivalents, $182M. 
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Pure Storage beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 8 Comments
  • TDOC

    Teladoc registers $175M stock offering; shares down 1% after hours

    • Teladoc (NYSE:TDOC) files an S-3 for a $175M offering of common stock. The prospectus also includes the sale of 1.2M common shares held by existing shareholders.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • STNG

    Scorpio Tankers to launch 30M-share offering

    • Scorpio Tankers (NYSE:STNG) -4.9% after-hours as it commences a public offering of 30M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 4.5M shares.
    • STNG says it plans to use the proceeds to strengthen its balance sheet and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 36 Comments
  • APTO

    Aptose registers sale of 6M shares by existing shareholder; shares down 2% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Aptose Biosciences (NASDAQ:APTO) files a preliminary prospectus with the SEC for the sale of 6,041,567 common shares held by institutional investor Aspire Capital. The company will receive no proceeds from the sales.
    • Shares are down 2% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    Marvell Tech up 1.9% after Q3, guidance beats

    • Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) shares are up 1.9% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Upside Q4 guidance has revenue from $595M to $625M (consensus: $589.95M) and EPS from $0.29 to $0.33 (consensus: $0.27)
    • Financials: Non-GAAP gross margin, 61.6%; cash and investments, $1.7B.   
    • Cavium will acquire all outstanding shares of Marvell with the transaction expected to close in mid-CY18. 
    • Press release 
    • Cavium shares are up 0.6%.      
    • Previously: Marvell Technology Group beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • ADSK

    Autodesk -12.6% after Q3 beats, positive guidance, restructuring plans

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) shares are down 12.6% after the company reports Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Q4 guidance has revenue from $537M to $547M (consensus: $544.8M) and EPS from -$0.14 to -$0.10 (consensus: -$0.14).
    • FY18 guidance: $2.04B to $2.05B (consensus: $2.05B); EPS, -$0.53 to -$0.49 (consensus: -$0.54). 
    • Key metrics: Subscription plan annualized recurring revenue, $924M (+108% Y/Y); total ARR, $1.9B (+25%); Subscription plan subscriptions, 1.9M (+307K Q/Q); total subscriptions, 3.6M (+146K Q/Q); deferred revenue, $1.76B (+15%); unbilled deferred revenue, $148M. 
    • Restructuring plan: Autodesk announces a restructuring plan to prioritize the subscription transition, which will involve some divestments. The company expects to take a pre-tax restructuring charge of $135M to $149M with $91M to $100M taken in Q4 and the rest in FY19. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Autodesk beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 29 Comments
  • NUAN

    Nuance Communications +3.4% after wrapping FY with profit, revenue beats

    • Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN) is up 3.4% after hours following fiscal Q4 earnings where it swung to a net loss on a GAAP basis but easily cleared Street expectations on the top and bottom lines.
    • It posted a net loss of $65.4M; on a non-GAAP basis, net income fell to $60.2M from $90.7M.
    • Recurring revenue made up 71% of total, up 100 bps Y/Y. Net new bookings were $424.4M, down 18%.
    • Revenue breakout: Professional services and hosting, $213.3M (down 13.2%); Product and licensing, $170.15M (down 4.7%); Maintenance and support, $82.5M (up 0.6%).
    • It's reiterating fiscal 2018 guidance for organic revenue growth of 2-4% (a 600 basis point improvement at the midpoint from last year) -- equating to non-GAAP revenue of $2.03B-$2.08B (above consensus for $2.01B) and EPS of $1.06-$1.15 (vs. $1.11 expected).
    • For fiscal Q1, it's guiding to revenues of $486M-$500M (above consensus for $485.1M) and EPS of $0.19-$0.22 (below an expected $0.25).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Pure Storage (NYSE:PSTG): Q3 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $278M (+41.1% Y/Y) beats by $5.3M.
    • Shares +2.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • GBTC

    Cryptocurrency conference fills up

    • "A few years ago, there’d be one-third the amount of people, and most of you would be in hoodies,” says early cryptocurrency proponent Brian Kelly, taking the stage at CoinDesk's crypto conference.
    • With Bitcoin fast-approaching $10K, today's conference was not only packed, but the suit-to-hoodie ratio was through the roof (if not infinite). Among those in attendance were reps from Morgan Stanley, Canaccord Genuity, Sequoia Capital, and, of course, CME Group, which in a few days is kicking off trading in Bitcoin futures.
    • Live feed here
    • Bitcoin earlier in the session came within a few bucks of $10K. It's currently higher by 3.7% to $9,926.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 32 Comments
  • NUAN

    Nuance Communications beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN): Q4 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $474.7M (-7.4% Y/Y) beats by $18.93M.
    • Shares +3.4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • CENX

    CNBC: U.S. launches anti-dumping case vs. Chinese aluminum producers

    • Aluminum names jump on a CNBC report that the U.S. is launching an anti-dumping case against Chinese aluminum producers covering imports of common alloy aluminum sheet: CENX +6.3%, ARNC +2.7%, AA +2.2%, ACH +1.4%, CSTM +0.9%, KALU +0.8%.
    • The investigations are "self-initiated" under the authority granted to the Secretary of Commerce under the Tariff Act of 1930, according to the report, which also says the last self-initiated anti-dumping duty investigation occurred in 1985 on semiconductors from Japan.
    • Sec. Ross says Chinese producers are selling aluminum sheet in the U.S. at prices that are less than fair value and that the Chinese government is providing unfair subsidies to producers of aluminum sheet, and the cases are not part of the pending Section 232 investigation into aluminum.
    • ETFs: JJU-OLD, FOIL
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 26 Comments
  • EMR

    Emerson upped at Cowen as Rockwell would have brought mediocre returns

    • Emerson Electric (EMR +3.6%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform with a $71 price target, up from $61, at Cowen, which says EMR's decision not to pursue (I, II) Rockwell Automation (ROK +3.1%) is a positive move, as an acquisition would have generated "mediocre" returns for years.
    • The acquisition also implied a "steep opportunity cost" vs. other lower risk alternatives, such as a stock buyback program that offers almost no risk and a potential for higher returns, Cowen says.
    • EMR likely will enjoy accelerating organic growth in FY 2018, as shown by recent order trends in its automation solutions segment, the firm says, and company-wide orders have been positive since March, which implies management is well positioned to oversee an organic upturn.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • PFE

    UK approves OTC version of Pfizer's Viagra; shares up 1%

    • Regulatory authorities in Britain have greenlighted over-the-counter status for Pfizer's (PFE +1%) erectile dysfunction (ED) med Viagra (sildenafil citrate), the first country in the world to do so.
    • The company plans to launch the product, branded as Viagra Connect, in early Q2 2018. It plans to continue marketing the prescription drug but sales will likely decline once the OTC version is available.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 32 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: OHGI +13%. SMIT +12%. QNST +11%. SOL +11%. AMBR +11%.
    • Losers: DPW -32%. MOMO -19%. XNET -19%. WSTL -12%. BITA -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • RGC

    Regal Entertainment reportedly a target of Cineworld

    • Movie theaters are on the move on reports of a deal between Regal Entertainment Group (RGC +7.8%) and Cineworld (OTC:CNWGY).
    • Sources tell Reuters that an offer from Cineworld values Regal at $23 per share.
    • Cinemark (CNK +3.8%), AMC Entertainment (AMC +5.5%) and IMAX (IMAX +1.4%) have all shot up as well on the M&A development.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 14 Comments
  • FB

    JPMorgan lists top AI picks, includes Facebook and Palo Alto

    • JPMorgan’s top AI picks include Facebook (FB), Oracle (ORCL +0.3%), and Palo Alto Networks (PANW -1%).
    • The firm has a $225 price target on Facebook and says, “Mark Zuckerberg considers AI to be one of the company’s 10-year bets.” 
    • Facebook can use computer vision tech to organize and classify content.
    • The firm has a $55 price target on Oracle and notes that the company now uses AI to automate the administration of its Oracle Database 18c, which makes it an autonomous database. 
    • Palo Alto Networks has a $182 price target and uses machine learning in Traps, its endpoint protection solution.   
    • Workday (WDAY -0.3%) is another pick with a $120 price target due to its use of predictive analytics. 
    • Twilio (TWLO +1.7%) gets a $40 price target thanks to the general availability of its speech recognition capabilities.     
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 23 Comments
  • SCS

    Steelcase announces definitive agreement to acquire AMQ Solutions

    • Steelcase (SCS +2.1%) has entered into definitive agreements to purchase all outstanding membership interests of AMQ and certain assets of an affiliated company in an all cash transaction.
    • The transaction is expected to be completed during Steelcase's Q418, subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals.
    • Following completion of the transaction, the AMQ offering is expected to be available through authorized Steelcase dealers in addition to AMQ's existing network of dealers and sales representatives.
    • AMQ's revenue for the trailing twelve months was ~$37M
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • BAC

    Big day for banks on Powell testimony

    • There aren't any too big to fail banks anymore, said Jay Powell at his Fed chair confirmation hearing today. Probed by Sen. Warren on whether post-crisis regulations need to be further strengthened, Powell replied that they're "tough enough."
    • That Powell was going to be of a de-regulatory bent isn't news, but bank investors seem to appreciate the direct talk to the Massachusetts Senator.
    • The KBE, KRE, and XLF are each up nearly 2%.
    • Bank of America (BAC +2.7%), JPMorgan (JPM +2.7%), Citigroup (C +2.2%), Wells Fargo (WFC +2%), Regions (RF +2.3%), Zions (ZION +2.7%), U.S. Bancorp (USB +1.8%), SunTrust (STI +2.7%), PNC Financial (PNC +1.7%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 26 Comments
  • VKTX

    Investors sell the news in Viking; shares down 7%

    • Shares in Viking Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VKTX) had more than tripled since this summer, so investors are lightening up following this morning's positive test results.
    • Up sharply in premarket action, Viking is now lower by 7.1% on the session.
    • Previously: Viking Therapeutics' VK5211 successful in mid-stage hip fracture study; shares up 18% premarket (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 6 Comments
  • NTIP

    Network-1 receives new patent from U.S. patent office expanding its Cox patent portfolio to 22 patents

    • Network-1 Technologies (NTIP +5%) announced that the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office issued U.S. Patent No. 9,832,266 ("Methods for Using Extracted Features to Perform an Action Associated with Identified Action Information") to Network-1.
    • The newly issued patent arises from a patent application contained in the patent portfolio acquired by Network-1 from Professor Ingemar Cox in 2013.
    • Since December 2016, Network-1 has received 10 new patents in the Portfolio. Since the acquisition of the Portfolio, Network-1 has filed 24 additional patent applications, 17 of which have been issued bringing the total Portfolio of granted patents to 22. 7 applications relating to the original specification are still pending and Network-1 anticipates further issuances of additional claims for this Portfolio.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 2 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: TUSK +8%.
    • Losers: SGY -16%. SE -13%. ZN -9%. WLB -8%. NOG -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • ROKU

    Roku dips as short firm Citron terms it 'total joke'

    • Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) -- minting stock gains of late, up 140% since Nov. 8 earnings -- has turned 2.8% lower as influential short seller Citron Research puts the company in the crosshairs of its latest thesis.
    • "Time to pop some real bubbles. ROKU, total joke," the firm tweets out. "Citron trusts Mark Mahaney at $28 price target and that is IF they can hold comp back.
    • "Today's Needham research is irresponsible. Unless $ROKU finds a way to stream a BTC -- this stock is MUCH LOWER ... caveat emptor."
    • Mahaney's $28 price target is against today's price of $45.16. Meanwhile, Needham set a Street-high price target of $50, saying Netflix is the best comp but that Roku is "materially cheaper" with less risk.
    • Citron says its Andrew Left will be on CNBC's Halftime Report tomorrow to discuss the Roku position.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 42 Comments
  • DCPH

    Deciphera's DCC-2618 an Orphan Drug for GIST; shares ahead 3%

    • The FDA designates Deciphera Pharmaceuticals' (DCPH +2.6%) DCC-2618 an Orphan Drug for the treatment of gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST).
    • Phase 1-stage DCC-2618 inhibits a broad range of mutations in kinases called KIT and PDGFRa that emerge during cancer progression or on treatment.
    • Among the benefits of Orphan Drug status in the U.S. is a seven-year period of market exclusivity for the indication, if approved.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • AIPT

    Skyline Medical up 6% on partnership with GLG Pharma

    • Thinly traded nano cap Skyline Medical (SKLN +5.6%) is up on average volume in response to the news that it, along with current collaborator Helomics, will partner with GLG Pharma to deliver personalized medicines and testing to ovarian and breast cancer patients, including those with ascites fluid (accumulation of fluid in the abdominal cavity).
    • The partnership will leverage GLG's Cell Capture, Culture and Screening System to help isolate ascites fluid samples that may contain cancer cells. Helomics' ChemoFx diagnostic platform will be used to determine likely response to chemo while Skyline's STREAMWAY System will handle fluid collection and disposal.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers:  APEN +53%. CREG +33%. OHGI +20%. OTCPK:OMNT +21%. COOL +16%. TEUM +14%. SMIT +14%. THO +13%. QNST +12%. OTCQB:MRDN +11%.
    • Losers:MARA -38%. DPW -38%. ISIG -20%. CERC -17%. MOMO -17%. OPHC -17%. PETX -16%. SGRP -16%. XNET -15%. ARCI -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 6 Comments
  • TTNP

    Titan Pharma to engage Molteni to distribute Probuphine in Europe; shares ahead 2%

    • Titan Pharmaceuticals (TTNP +2.2%) inks a binding term sheet with Florence, Italy-based specialty pharma firm L. Molteni & C. dei F.lli Alitti Società di Esercizio S.p.A. under which Molteni will have an exclusive license to commercialize Probuphine in the European Union. A formal contract should be signed next quarter.
    • Under the terms of the deal, Molteni will pay Titan €2M upfront, up to €4M in regulatory milestones and tiered low-teens-to-mid-twenties royalties on net sales. Molteni will have the right, until June 30, 2019, to expand the territory to include the Middle East and North Africa and/or the Commonwealth of Independent States (11 former Soviet Republics) by paying Titan a €1M fee per group (Middle East and North Africa constitute one group).
    • The European marketing application seeking approval for Probuphine to treat opioid dependence is currently under EMA review. Molteni can terminate the agreement if the application is not approved.
    • Previously: Titan Pharma's Probuphine marketing application in Europe accepted for review (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • AYTU

    Monthly prescriptions up 17% sequentially for Aytu's Natesto; shares ahead 1%

    • Aytu BioScience (AYTU +1%) reports that total Natesto prescriptions for October were 827, up 17% from September. New prescriptions were 495. Total number prescribers was 407, up 16% sequentially.
    • The company acquired the U.S. rights to Natesto, a testosterone nasal gel for the treatment of hypogonadal men, from Acerus Pharmaceuticals in April 2016.
    • Previously: Aytu Bio secures U.S. rights to testosterone nasal gel from Acerus Pharma (April 25, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • KBR

    KBR wins concept and FEED contract for Statoil's Northern Lights project

    • KBR (KBR +1.9%) is higher on news it was awarded the front-end engineering and design contract for Statoil's (STO +0.3%) Northern Lights project to develop an onshore carbon dioxide storage terminal in Norway; financial details are not disclosed.
    • The terminal is a key component of the carbon capture and storage demonstration project being undertaken by Gassnova, where STO in partnership with Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) and Total (NYSE:TOT) are responsible for transport and storage.
    • Construction of the full-scale project including an onshore terminal is subject to the Norwegian parliament making a positive investment decision, scheduled for 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • TEUM

    Pareteum +14.7% on three-year China MVNO deal

    • Pareteum (NYSEMKT:TEUM) is up 14.7% after winning a three-year contract from a China-focused mobile virtual network operator.
    • It's an outgrowth of a strategic alliance with Artilium Plc to pursue new and developed markets.
    • Pareteum will provide Communications Platform-as-a-Service to the MVNO operator, offering cross-border mobile service in China and North America. Services will initially include messaging and data before expanding into other offerings.
    • It's a three-year deal that Pareteum expects will add more than $1M to its 36-month backlog.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 1 Comment

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: KBSF +12%. THO +11%. KOSS +8%. ROX +6%. WGO +6%.
    • Losers: ADOM -12%. UQM -6%. SGOC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • WEN

    Wendy's higher after Arby's stake gets juicier

    • Wendy's (NYSE:WEN) is up 3% on the day and the company's 18.5% stake in Arby's has a lot to do with the share price gain. Earlier today, Arby's owner Roark Capital snapped up Buffalo Wild Wings.
    • Stifel Nicolaus analyst Chris O'Cull explains: "This implies a value of $1.76 billion for Arby's... following the acquisition of BWLD, Arby's Restaurant Group excluding debt would theoretically be valued at roughly $4.2 billion. Wendy's stake would then be valued at $775 million before tax."
    • Previously: Restaurant watch: Who's next after Buffalo Wild Wings takeout deal? (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 3 Comments
  • APVO

    Aptevo to launch mid-stage study of otlertuzumab in PTCL this quarter; shares ahead 1%

    • Aptevo Therapeutics (APVO +1%) will launch an open-label proof-of-concept Phase 2 clinical trial this quarter evaluating monospecific antibody candidate otlertuzumab, combined with the chemo agent bendamustine, for the treatment of peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL), a new indication. The primary endpoint of the 24-subject study will be response rate.
    • Enrollment of patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) will be discontinued but the company says it will explore partnerships to support Phase 3 development in CLL.
    • Otlertuzumab targets a B-cell surface protein called CD37 which is also present on the surface of T-cell lymphomas.
    • Aptevo expects to file INDs in 2018 for two bispecific antibody candidates developed with its ADAPTIR platform: APVO436 for acute myeloid leukemia and APVO210 for autoimmune and inflammatory diseases.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 5 Comments
  • RIO

    Copper slides on worries over Chinese demand

    • Copper prices are lower for a second straight day, with concern about the outlook for metals demand from China hitting mining stocks, including RIO -1.1%, BHP -0.9%, SCCO -0.9%, FCX -0.5%.
    • Comex copper for March delivery fell 1.6% to $3.10/lb., and has retreated from last month’s three-year highs amid doubts that consumption from China, the world’s largest consumer of base metals, will continue to support high prices.
    • China's government warned last week of a possible bubble in stock markets and initiated measures to reduce financial market risks, resulting in "interest rates in China rising further, which also appears to be seen as a warning signal of tighter liquidity,” Commerzbank analysts say.
    • But demand from China generally has been strong this year and copper’s supply-demand fundamentals look solid good going into 2018, says INTL FCStone strategist Edward Meir, who does not see a major move lower.
    • ETFs: JJC, DBB, CPER, BOM, BOS, JJM, CUPM, BDD, RJZ, BDG-OLD, UBM, HEVY
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 25 Comments

  • RDS.A

    Shell strategy seems vindicated as it restores cash dividend, hikes free cash flow outlook

    • Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) maintains strong gains of ~3.5% following the cancellation of its scrip dividend program and plans for $25B in share buybacks through 2020.
    • But Shell also raises its outlook for annual organic free cash flow to $25B-$30B by 2020 at Brent crude of $60/bbl, up $5B from its previous goal and including $10B of cash flow from operations of new projects by 2018 as it remains on track to deliver production of 1M boe/day.
    • Shell says its $30B divestment program launched in 2016 to cut debt was “almost delivered,” with $25B of asset sales completed or agreed and another $5B in “advanced progress,” placing its debt to capitalization ratio - 25.4% at the end of Q3 - "within sight” of its target of 20%, and further sales would continue at an average rate of at least $5B/year until 2020.
    • The company also sets a new target to reduce the net carbon footprint of its energy products by 20% by 2035 and by ~50% by 2050, and its new energies division is planned to be one of Shell’s main growth engines after 2020 and generate returns of 8%-9%.

  • MYL

    Mylan shakes off perceived generic threat to EpiPen, shares up 1%

    • Mylan N.V. (MYL +1.3%) is up 3% from its intraday low of $35.92, shrugging off initial selling pressure on potential headwinds to EpiPen (epinephrine injection).
    • Investors first reacted to new FDA guidance on a streamlined approval process for generic versions of complex medicines like EpiPen that will allow approval of substitute products that have some design differences from the reference product as long as those differences don't affect the ability of patients to use it as intended.
    • FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb, M.D., says, "Under this guidance, so long as the generic applicant is able to demonstrate with data, where appropriate, that differences in design of the generic product do not affect the clinical effect or safety profile when the generic is substituted for the branded product, the generic product can be approved as a competitor to the branded drug where all other requirements for generic approval are met."
    • EpiPen already faces competition, such as Impax Labs' Adrenaclick, but they cannot be directly substituted by pharmacies under historical FDA guidelines when they receive a prescription for EpiPen.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 2 Comments
